meanings.definition: The highest point of a roof, where the two sides meet.
meanings.sent1: The ridgepole of the house was covered in snow.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter carefully secured the ridgepole in place.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the ridgepole, singing a morning song.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the ridgepole cast a long shadow over the yard.
meanings.sent5: During the storm, the wind howled through the gaps in the ridgepole.

meanings.definition: A beam running along the peak of a roof to support the roof structure.
meanings.sent1: The old barn needed a new ridgepole to keep the roof from sagging.
meanings.sent2: The ridgepole was made of sturdy oak to withstand heavy snow loads.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to walk along the narrow ridgepole.
meanings.sent4: The ridgepole stood strong, holding up the weight of the entire roof.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter measured twice before cutting the ridgepole to ensure a perfect fit.
